conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m formally applying to School_C as my first choice. I’m especially drawn to School_C’s academic environment and would be excited to commit and contribute to the community if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C, so I should apply immediately to maximize the chance of securing it. Although School_C ranks me 4th (behind Students B, C, and D), applying now is still optimal because waiting only increases the risk that higher-priority students take the single seat first. I will emphasize genuine fit and commitment to encourage acceptance if they have discretion among applicants.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority ranks Student_E 4th (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D). Although Student_E is applying to me as their first choice, accepting now would fill my only seat and prevent matching with higher-priority students who are likely to apply later (Student_B has School_C as 3rd; Student_C as 2nd; Student_D as 2nd; several students rank School_B first and may be rejected/redirected). With quota 1, it is optimal to hold out for higher-ranked candidates rather than lock in Student_E in round 1.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_A and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining School_B. Even so, applying now is my best chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills; if rejected, I can move quickly to School_C next round.

conversation.message:

Also, Student_E (my top choice) did not apply this round, so I should keep flexibility to match with a higher-priority student later rather than accept A now.

Also, Student_B lists School_A as first choice, so there is some risk they might prefer A, but under this protocol an ACCEPT with their APPLY establishes a match, so I should lock in B.
